intro: Rosa micrantha var. salviifolia, commonly known as the salvia-leaved rose, is a hybrid rose species characterized by its distinctive foliage. It features lance-shaped leaves that resemble those of the salvia plant, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States, often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
